Class Tile

java.lang.Object
engine.forBoard.Tile
Direct Known Subclasses:
Tile.EmptyTile, Tile.OccupiedTile
public abstract class Tile extends Object
The Tile class represents a single square on a chess board. This abstract class provides the base functionality for chess board tiles and offers methods to determine if a tile is occupied and which piece occupies it. The implementation uses the Flyweight pattern for empty tiles to minimize memory usage.

Subclasses of Tile include EmptyTile for unoccupied squares and OccupiedTile for squares containing chess pieces. The class provides a factory method for creating the appropriate type of tile based on whether a piece is present.

Author:
Aaron Ho

    The EmptyTile class represents an empty tile on a chess board.

  • Field Details

    • tileCoordinate

      protected final int tileCoordinate
      The coordinate of the tile on the chess board. This value ranges from 0 to 63, representing the tiles from a8 to h1.

    • EMPTY_TILES_CACHE

      private static final Map<Integer,Tile.EmptyTile> EMPTY_TILES_CACHE
      Cache containing all possible empty tiles on the chess board. This map uses the Flyweight pattern to reuse empty tile objects rather than creating new instances for each empty square, improving memory efficiency.

  • Constructor Details

    • Tile

      private Tile(int tileCoordinate)
      Constructs a Tile with the specified coordinate. This constructor is protected and used by subclasses to initialize the tile's position on the board.
      Parameters:
      tileCoordinate - The coordinate of the tile on the board (0-63).

  • Method Details

    • createAllPossibleEmptyTiles

      private static Map<Integer,Tile.EmptyTile> createAllPossibleEmptyTiles()
      Initializes a map containing all possible empty tiles (0-63) to avoid creating new empty tile instances during board creation or move execution. This method is used to populate the EMPTY_TILES_CACHE when the class is loaded.
      Returns:
      An ImmutableMap of Integer to EmptyTile, containing all possible empty tiles.

    • createTile

      public static Tile createTile(int tileCoordinate, Piece piece)
      Factory method that creates a tile at the given coordinate, either empty or occupied depending on whether a piece is provided. This method returns a cached EmptyTile instance if no piece is provided, or creates a new OccupiedTile if a piece is present.
      Parameters:
      tileCoordinate - The coordinate of the tile on the board (0-63).
      piece - The piece to place on the tile, or null for an empty tile.
      Returns:
      A new Tile instance of the appropriate type.

    • isTileOccupied

      public abstract boolean isTileOccupied()
      Determines whether the tile is occupied by a chess piece.
      Returns:
      true if the tile is occupied, false if it is empty.

    • getPiece

      public abstract Piece getPiece()
      Returns the piece on this tile, if any.
      Returns:
      The piece on this tile, or null if the tile is empty.

    • getTileCoordinate

      public int getTileCoordinate()
      Returns the coordinate of this tile on the chess board.
      Returns:
      The tile coordinate, a value between 0 and 63.
